oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tennessee State Fair, 1961 September 10
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A view of the Tennessee State Fairgrounds, September 10th, 1961. The Tennessee State Fair, located approximately 2 miles south of downtown Nashville, has been held every year since 1906, with the exception of a four-year span during World War II. It was in 1965 that a fire destroyed a majority of the fairgrounds and another fire in 1970. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Tennessee State Fairgrounds (Nashville, Tenn.)
